channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Supreme Court rules passports to list sex at birth
item.description: The Supreme Court allowed President Trump to proceed with his plan to require that passport applicants list their sex as what is designated on their birth certificate.
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court allowed President Trump to proceed with his plan to require that passport applicants list their sex as what is designated on their birth certificate.
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: 'She was fearless from the start,' says Nancy Pelosi biographer
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Susan Page, the author of Madam Speaker: Nancy Pelosi and the Lessons of Power about Pelosi's legacy, following the congresswoman's decision not to seek reelection.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Susan Page, the author of Madam Speaker: Nancy Pelosi and the Lessons of Power about Pelosi's legacy, following the congresswoman's decision not to seek reelection.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Intagliata

item.title: Federal judge orders full funding of SNAP benefits
item.description: A Rhode Island federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to find enough money to restore full funding for SNAP benefits by Friday.
item.content:encoded: A Rhode Island federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to find enough money to restore full funding for SNAP benefits by Friday.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: States renegotiate their share of the Colorado River without federal intervention
item.description: The Trump administration is using different tactics that his predecessor to get the states the share the Colorado river to agree how to do it in a climate changed world.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is using different tactics that his predecessor to get the states the share the Colorado river to agree how to do it in a climate changed world.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hager

item.title: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi will not seek reelection
item.description: Rep. Nancy Pelosi, the first woman ever elected Speaker of the House, announced Thursday that after 38 years in Congress, she will not seek another term.
item.content:encoded: Rep. Nancy Pelosi, the first woman ever elected Speaker of the House, announced Thursday that after 38 years in Congress, she will not seek another term.
item.dc:creator: Scott Shafer

item.title: Airlines and travelers scramble to prepare for cuts in air traffic
item.description: Airlines are gearing up for a 10% reduction in flights ordered by the Federal Aviation Administration. The agency says it's necessary to keep the nation's airspace safe during the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: Airlines are gearing up for a 10% reduction in flights ordered by the Federal Aviation Administration. The agency says it's necessary to keep the nation's airspace safe during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: How a political fight on the right affects national security
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with domestic extremism correspondent Odette Yousef about Tucker Carlson's interview with white nationalist and holocaust denier Nick Fuentes and the rift it's creating.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with domestic extremism correspondent Odette Yousef about Tucker Carlson's interview with white nationalist and holocaust denier Nick Fuentes and the rift it's creating.
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: Damage from Hurricane Melissa is still blocking aid to Jamaica's residents
item.description: We take a look at how the disaster response is unfolding in Jamaica and what that recovery looks like. The U.S. has supplied support and money towards the effort but is it enough. Tanis/Davis
item.content:encoded: We take a look at how the disaster response is unfolding in Jamaica and what that recovery looks like. The U.S. has supplied support and money towards the effort but is it enough. Tanis/Davis
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: Funding for space missions hang in the balance with the government shutdown
item.description: Planetary science is in limbo during the government shutdown — things like analyzing asteroids, studying the magnetosphere of Jupiter, or better understanding Mars so that humans might one day visit.
item.content:encoded: Planetary science is in limbo during the government shutdown — things like analyzing asteroids, studying the magnetosphere of Jupiter, or better understanding Mars so that humans might one day visit.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Sydney Sweeney stars as boxer Christy Martin, who faced violence in and out of the ring
item.description: Christy Martin was a star boxer in the 1990s, but she also endured decades of abuse outside the ring.
item.content:encoded: Christy Martin was a star boxer in the 1990s, but she also endured decades of abuse outside the ring.
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco
